Write-Up Text: People in Australia are discussing the upcoming budget and its potential impact on the community. Some advocate for more support for disadvantaged people including a focus on increasing the JobSeeker payment. Meanwhile a coalition of charity organizations politicians academics business leaders and community advocates is urging the Prime Minister to deliver a substantial increase to JobSeeker and Youth Allowance as recommended by the Government's own Economic Inclusion Advisory Committee. Others are concerned with the potential negative impact of new policies such as the Labor government's plan to double the amount of medicines Australians can purchase by allowing 60-day dispensing as part of their shake-up of the Pharmaceutical Benefits Scheme (PBS) on local pharmacies. On a positive note NRMA and the federal government have confirmed their deal to invest in charging infrastructure for electric vehicles in regional Australia.
